President Trump on Friday outlined a new plan to impose his global tariffs after the Supreme Court struck down most of the levies as illegal — a decision he lambasted as "deeply disappointing."
Trump also warned: "During the next short number of months, the Trump Administration will determine and issue the new and legally permissible Tariffs."

title: Klaebo Sets Record With Sixth Gold at 2026 Winter Olympics
snippets: Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo, Norway's king of cross-country skiing, breaks the record for the most gold medals won at a single Winter Olympics with his sixth of the Games.

Norwegian cross-country skier Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo became the first athlete to win six gold medals at a single Winter Olympics after continuing his stunning run with victory in the 50km mass start.

Norway’s Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo captures his sixth gold medal of the 2026 Winter Olympics in the 50-kilometre mass start race to set a record for most golds at a single Games with four individual and two team wins.
Klaebo’s victory in the 50-kilometre mass start race shattered the nearly 50-year record set by American speed skater Eric Heiden, who won five golds in the 1980 Lake Placid Olympics.

Victory in 50km mass start breaks record from 1980 Teammates Nyenget and Iversen lock out podium At the end of one of the great races in the history of the Winter Olympics, there was the greatest athlete in the history of the Winter Olympics. After a little over two hours of racing Johannes Høsflot
Norway's Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo sets the record for the most golds won at a single Winter Olympics, winning his sixth, and the 11th of his career, in the men's 50km mass start.
titles: Six races, six golds - Klaebo's historic Olympics

summary: Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo won his sixth gold medal at the 2026 Winter Olympics in the men's 50km mass start, setting a new record for the most golds won by an athlete at a single Winter Olympics. This surpasses the previous record of five set in 1980, and brings Klaebo's career total to 11 Olympic gold medals.

snippets: More than 150 giant tortoises have been reintroduced to Ecuador’s Floreana Island in the Galapagos.

title: Rain Washes Out Pakistan vs New Zealand T20 World Cup Super Eights
snippets: Persistent rain in Colombo forces abandonment of Pakistan's game with New Zealand, which was to open Super Eights stage.
The T20 World Cup Super 8s began in frustrating fashion with Pakistan's game against New Zealand in Colombo washed out without a ball bowled.

COLOMBO, Sri Lanka (AP) — Pakistan and New Zealand's opening Super Eights match at the T20 World Cup was abandoned on Saturday because of rain without a ball being bowled. The rain started at Colombo's R. Premadasa Stadium as soon as Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha won the toss and chose to bat first. The persistent rain eventually led to the umpires calling off the Group 2 game with the teams awarded a point each. Tournament co-host India plays South Africa in Ahmedabad in the first Group 1 match on Sunday, when co-host Sri Lanka and England meet in Group 2 in Pallekele. ___ AP cricket:...
